title: CNBC Daily Open: After SVB collapse, stricter rules coming for banks?
description: Regulators said they favor more stringent rules for banks with more than $100 billion in assets, causing bank stocks to dip.

title: Jamie Dimon is being deposed over JPMorgan Chase role in Epstein lawsuits
description: The suits allege that New York-based JPMorgan Chase ignored red flags about Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Lucid to cut 1,300 workers amid signs of flagging demand for its EVs
description: Lucid CEO Peter Rawlinson said the job cuts will hit "nearly every organization and level, including executives."

title: Apple launches its Pay Later service
description: Apple on Tuesday introduced Apple Pay Later, which will allow users to split their purchases into four payments spread over six weeks.

title: SVB customers tried to withdraw nearly all the bank’s deposits over two days, Fed's Barr testifies
description: The run on Silicon Valley Bank's deposits this month went far deeper than was initially known.

title: The salt paradox: Why it's both essential and a threat to the environment
description: The global market for salt was worth over an estimated $13 billion in 2021, according to Research Insights.

title: Goldman Sachs says generative A.I. could impact 300 million jobs — here's which ones
description: Artificial intelligence could automate up to a quarter of work in the U.S., a Goldman Sachs report says. Here's the most affected sectors and countries.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried paid over $40 million to bribe at least one Chinese official, DOJ alleges in new indictment
description: FTX co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried paid out tens of millions of dollars worth of bribes to at least one Chinese government official, federal prosecutors alleged in a new indictment Tuesday.

title: 'Be very vigilant': Bank of England chief says the market is testing banks to identify weakness
description: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey on Tuesday vowed to be "very vigilant" amid ongoing volatility.

title: 4G internet is set to arrive on the moon later this year
description: The aim is to show that terrestrial networks can meet the communications needs of future space missions.

title: Alibaba to split into 6 units and explore IPOs; shares pop 6%
description: Alibaba said Tuesday it will split its company into six business groups, each with the ability to raise outside funding and go public.

title: Elon Musk says only verified users will show up in Twitter's recommendation feed in further shake-up
description: Elon Musk announced that, going forward, only verified accounts will show up in the "For You" recommendation section of Twitter.

title: Energy agency chief warns transition to renewables is way off track, issues warning on stranded assets
description: The energy transition is off track to prevent the worst impact of the climate emergency, according to the head of the International Renewable Energy Agency.

title: Killer drones and multi-billion dollar deals: Turkey's rapidly-growing defense industry is boosting its global clout
description: Turkish weapons sales, ramped up to meet surging demand due to the war in Ukraine, are bolstering its influence in Europe, the Middle East and beyond.

title: Asia is an area of certainty amid global volatility, says China's Boao Forum outlook
description: Asia, especially China, is an area of certainty amid global uncertainty, according to an annual economic outlook report released at the Boao Forum in Hainan.

title: CNBC Daily Open: First Citizens made a good deal
description: Investors liked First Citizens Bank's deal to buy Silicon Valley Bank’s deposits and loans so much that they pushed its stock 53.74% higher.

title: This is not another banking crisis, analysts say — it's 'sentiment contagion' instead
description: Friday's plunge in Deutsche Bank's share price — despite relatively strong capital and liquidity positions — left many market watchers confounded.

title: U.S.-China relations are going downhill with ‘no trust’ on either side, Stephen Roach says
description: Tensions between the U.S and China have been rising over the years, ranging from trade and tariffs to tech rivalry and alleged spying.

title: Private equity deals in Asia plunged 44% in 2022. More uncertainty may be ahead
description: China and India accounted for a drop of $35 billion in total deal value for large growth deals for the year, Bain & Co said in a Tuesday report.
